page.title: 01PRINCIPAL FEATURES
page.content: This block contains half the Parish of Kingsland and most of the Parish of Eyton. All the block is cultivated except for two small areas of common land. The majority of houses and cottages are timber framed, many dating from the 16th and 17th centuries, some faced with stone or brick in the 18th century. There are a few Georgian and Victorian houses, brick built, and several private and council houses built in the present century, much of the development being since 1969. The River Lugg flows across the left of the block. The flat land of the river valley consists of gravel and other deposits from the Ice Age and since, giving rise to a grat variety of soil. Higher land near Eyton is Devonian.
